they changed up the exp formula if you
remember from the last video the exp
formula for most Pokemon games is pretty
simple it's simply the pokemons base exp
multiplied by its level and then you
divide that number by 7
however with Pokemon black and white
they changed up the formula just a
little bit to something like
this once again you take the pokémons
bass exp and multiply it by its level
but this time we're dividing by five
then once you get that number we're
going to multiply it by this yeah that's
a lot of math and all you really need to
know is if your Pokemon is lower level
than the Pokemon it beats you'll get
more exp and if your pokemons higher
level than the Pokemon you beat you'll
get less exp so that means since we're
trying to get the most XP possible it's
gonna have to be with a level 1 Pokemon
anything higher than level 1 will get
less exp now pokemon black and white
have some very strong trainers using
Pokemon all the way up to level 77 like

now even though that Garchomp is tied

next Aran has the ability sturdy which

and we just beat a level 65 Pokemon

and white - next we're gonna talk about
Pokemon Sun and Moon
now Sun Moon use the exact same exp
formula as black and white so once again
our strategy to get the most XP possible
is by defeating a high leveled pokemon
with a level 1 Pokemon however Sun and
Moon did have a few interesting exp
changes first we no longer get bonus exp
for being in a trainer battle and second
now every pokemon that participates in a
battle automatically gets the full
amount of exp that means we don't have
to use any more fancy strategies like
the Aaron and hippo from generation 5
and instead all we have to do they get
the most exp is just start off the
battle with our level 1 Pokemon and swap
into something else that can defeat the
enemy now the Pokemon that gives the
most exp and Sun and Moon is surprise
surprise a level 55 chauncey however
finding this level 55 chancy is very
annoying to get into a battle with a
level 55 chancy you need to go to the
Pony Grove area and at the Pony Grove
you can't find Chauncey by itself you
need to encounter a riolu first and get
it to call a Chanti for help now finding
a riolu is already annoying enough
because it only has a 10% encounter
rates and once you get into that battle
battling it is also pretty annoying to
riolu knows a move called final gambit
and if it uses it it'll knock itself out
and end your chain so to avoid this I'm
gonna use a ghost type Pokemon so it
can't hit me now once I'm in the chain I
have to get lucky enough for it to not
only call
[ __ ] see for help when it keeps calling
for you'll lose over and over again but
it also has to be level 55 for us to get
the maximum exp this took me well over 2
hours just to get the footage now for
bonus multipliers we're gonna be using
the foreign trade bonus 1.7 times the
health idol lucky egg and we'll be using
a new bonus called affection if your
Pokemon has more than two affection
hearts and Sun and Moon and the ultra
games it'll get a bonus 1.2 times exp
all this together gives my level 1
Caterpie a grand total of fifty nine
thousand two hundred and sixty two exp
for defeating this Chauncey but moving
on to ultra Sun and Moon the exp gets
way better here first and foremost a new
bonus exp was added the Rotom lottery
exp this will give us another 1.5 times
and on top of that not only is Chauncey
easier to find an ultra Sun and Moon it
also has the chance of calling up up
Lisi and if you remember Blissey from my

Blissey using the foreign trade bonus
the affection bonus the lucky egg bonus
and the Rotom exp bonus we get ourselves

two thousand eight hundred and forty six
exp points and that brings our little
Caterpie from level 1 to level 52 but
we're not done with ultra Sun and Moon
yet my next and final test for this

before switched in my Caterpie so it

then with a move that would knock them

six hundred and fifty four exp and that
